snippet: The Mormon practice of baptizing dead relatives offends some Jews, especially when the subjects are Holocaust victims, even though that is against church policy.
abstract: Mark Oppenheimer Beliefs column describes how the Mormon practice of baptizing Jews after their death, particularly Holocaust victims like Anne Frank, has offended many Jews.
lead_paragraph: The Mormon practice of baptizing dead relatives offends some Jews, especially when the subjects are Holocaust victims, even though that is against church policy.

headline.print_headline: A Twist on Posthumous Baptisms Leaves Jews Miffed at Mormon Rite
headline.seo: Jews Take Issue With Posthumous Mormon Baptisms — Beliefs
headline.main: A Twist on Posthumous Baptisms Leaves Jews Miffed at Mormon Rite

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Mormons (Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-Day Saints)
